document.docAuthor: Motamedinia, Behnam, Skevington, Jeffrey H. & Kelso, Scott
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

bibRefCitation.author: De Meyer, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: De Meyer, M. (1995) The pipunculid flies of Israel and the Sinai (Insecta, Diptera, Pipunculidae). Spixiana, 18, 283 - 319.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: This species can be recognized by elongated surstyli and epandrium in dorsal view ( Fig. 30A ); unequal gonopods, left is higher than right one in ventral view ( Fig. 30B ); both surstyli slightly straight, bent towards sternite in apical third in lateral view ( Fig. 30C–D ). Based on the shape of surstyli in dorsal view, this species resembles species in the kuthyi group (
Tomosvaryella cyprusensis
sp. nov.
,
T. emaratensis
sp. nov.
,
T. freidbergi
,
T. hispanica , T. israelensis
,
T. kuthyi
). It differs by the shape of surstyli in lateral view, bent towards sternite in apical third ( Fig. 30C–D ). See diagnosis of
T. emaratensis
sp. nov.
and T. cyprusensis
sp. nov.
for more details.

Specimens examined: HOLOTYPE
: ISRAEL : Sinai Ofira, 22iii.1981 , A. Freidberg, JSS52379 ( 1♂ , TAU);
PARATYPE

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 30. Male genitalia of
Tomosvaryella parakuthyi
(CNC470694, CNC) A) dorsal view, B) ventral view, C, D) lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note: DNA barcodes of
T. parakuthyi
are most similar to
T. kuthyi ,
differing by 2.3% (pairwise divergence) (Supplementary Table 1 ).
